com.aevi.print.model

Class PrintPayload

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aevi.print.model.PrintPayload
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Jsonable

    public class PrintPayload
extends java.lang.Object
implements Jsonable
    A PrintPayload contains a collection of PrintRow that represent a printable text document. By binding to the PrinterManager this pay load can be send to the receipt printer for printing.

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates an empty PrintPayload object.
      PrintPayload(java.lang.String printerId)
      Creates an empty PrintPayload object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PrintPayload

        public PrintPayload()
        Creates an empty PrintPayload object.

      • PrintPayload

        public PrintPayload(java.lang.String printerId)
        Creates an empty PrintPayload object. To be sent to a specific printer driver
        Parameters:
        printerId - The id of the printer to send this payload to for printing

    • Method Detail

      • append

        public TextRow append(java.lang.String text)
        Appends the given text row to this printer pay load.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to append to the printer pay load. This parameter must not be null.
        Returns:
        The new TextRow object added to the payload

      • append

        public TextRow append(java.lang.String text,
                      PrinterFont printerFont)
        Appends the given text row to this printer payload and ensure the printer font given is used The font must match a PrinterFont as provided by the printer via its settings methods. See PrinterSettings.getPrinterFonts().
        Parameters:
        text - The text to add
        printerFont - The printer font to use

      • append

        public void append(PrintPayload toAppendPayload)
        Appends another printPayload to this printer pay load
        Parameters:
        toAppendPayload - The payload to append

      • appendEmptyLine

        public void appendEmptyLine()
        Add an empty line to the pay load

      • appendLineOfChar

        public TextRow appendLineOfChar(int columns,
                                java.lang.String character)
        Appends a line of the same character to this print payload
        Parameters:
        columns - The number of columns to send the character for
        character - The character to use for the line
        Returns:
        The new TextRow object added to the payload

      • appendLeftRight

        public TextRow appendLeftRight(int columns,
                               java.lang.String left,
                               java.lang.String right)
        Appends two strings to a line one aligned left one right
        Parameters:
        columns - The number of text columns to assume for the row
        left - The String to put on the left
        right - The String to put on the right
        Returns:
        The new TextRow object added to the payload

      • append

        public ImageRow append(android.graphics.Bitmap image)
        Appends the given image to this printer pay load. The default alignment of the image is left.
        Parameters:
        image - the image to append to this printer pay load. This parameter must not be null.
        Returns:
        The new ImageRow object added to the payload

        public ImageRow append(android.graphics.Bitmap image,
                       boolean scaleToFit)

      • getRows

        public PrintRow[] getRows()
        Gets the rows in this printer pay load.
        Returns:
        the rows in this printer pay load

      • getCodePage

        public int getCodePage()
        Get the codepage to be used when printing out this payload
        Returns:
        A code page id. -1 indicates the default code page is being used.

      • setCodePage

        public void setCodePage(int codePage)
        Sets the codepage to be used when printing this payload
        Parameters:
        codePage - The codepage. See printer specific documentation for details. Set to -1 for the default codepage.

      • getLanguage

        public java.lang.String getLanguage()
        Returns:
        Gets the ISO-639 language code set for this payload or null for the default

      • setLanguage

        public void setLanguage(java.lang.String languageCode)
        Sets the language code to be used for this print payload
        Parameters:
        languageCode - An ISO-639 two letter language code (usually obtained from Locale.getLanguage() if required)

      • setPrinterId

        public void setPrinterId(java.lang.String printerId)
        Sets the id of the printer that should be used to print this payload
        Parameters:
        printerId - The printerId. Should be an id of a printer returned

      • getPrinterId

        public java.lang.String getPrinterId()
        Returns the id of the printert that should be used to print this payload
        Returns:
        The id of the printer

      • hasPrinterId

        public boolean hasPrinterId()
        Returns:
        True if a printer has been selected for this payload
